events.title: Armistice Day Ends World War I
events.description: An armistice agreement was signed between the Allies and Germany, ending hostilities on the Western Front and effectively concluding World War I.
events.significance: Marked the end of one of the deadliest conflicts in history and led to significant geopolitical changes worldwide.

events.title: Unveiling of the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Arlington
events.description: The United States unveiled the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier at Arlington National Cemetery to honor unidentified American soldiers who died in World War I.
events.significance: Symbolizes respect and remembrance for all unidentified and missing soldiers, becoming a central part of Veteran and Memorial Day observances.

events.title: Angola Achieves Independence from Portugal
events.description: After a protracted liberation war, Angola officially gained its independence from Portuguese colonial rule.
events.significance: Marked the end of Portuguese colonialism in Angola and initiated a new era of self-governance and conflict in the region.

events.title: Mike Tyson Becomes the Youngest Heavyweight Boxing Champion
events.description: At age 20, Mike Tyson won the WBC heavyweight title, becoming the youngest boxer ever to win a heavyweight championship.
events.significance: Signaled the rise of one of boxing's most dominant and controversial figures.

events.title: China Joins the World Trade Organization (WTO)
events.description: China became a formal member of the WTO, integrating its economy more fully into the global trade system.
events.significance: Marked a major milestone in globalization, significantly impacting international trade and economics.
